meanings.definition: The outer covering of a seed or fruit
meanings.sent1: The hull of the apple protected the seeds inside.
meanings.sent2: She peeled the orange to reveal the juicy hull.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the hull of the acorn for a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The hull of the watermelon split open, revealing the red flesh inside.
meanings.sent5: The hull of the coconut was tough and fibrous.

meanings.definition: The main body of a ship
meanings.sent1: The hull of the ship was painted blue.
meanings.sent2: The sailors repaired the hull after it was damaged in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The pirates searched the hull for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: The hull of the ship creaked as it sailed through the rough seas.
meanings.sent5: The hull of the boat was sturdy and reliable.

meanings.definition: To remove the outer covering of a seed or fruit
meanings.sent1: She carefully hulled the strawberries for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef hulled the avocado before slicing it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally hulled the cherry while trying to pit it.
meanings.sent4: The farmer hulled the corn to prepare it for cooking.
meanings.sent5: They hulled the peas to use in the soup.
